org.whizu.jquery.mobile

Class Listview

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.whizu.jquery.mobile.Listview

  • public class Listview
extends Object
    A listview is coded as a simple unordered list containing linked list items with a data-role="listview" attribute. jQuery Mobile will apply all the necessary styles to transform the list into a mobile-friendly listview with right arrow indicator that fills the full width of the browser window. When you tap on the list item, the framework will trigger a click on the first link inside the list item, issue an Ajax request for the URL in the link, create the new page in the DOM, then kick off a page transition.
    Author:
    Rudy D'hauwe

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter(boolean filter)
        Adds a search filter bar to the listview.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException

      • setAutodividers

        public void setAutodividers(boolean autodividers)
        A listview can be configured to automatically generate dividers for its items by adding a data-autodividers="true" attribute to any listview. By default, the text used to create dividers is the uppercased first letter of the item's text. Alternatively you can specify divider text by setting the autodividersSelector option on the listview programmatically. This feature is designed to work seamlessly with the filter.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException

      • setFilterReveal

        public void setFilterReveal(boolean filterReveal)
        The filter reveal feature makes is easy to build a simple autocomplete with local data. When a filterable list has the filter reveal attribute, it will auto-hide all the list items when the search field is blank.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException

      • setInset

        public void setInset(boolean inset)
        Adding the inset attribute to the list, applies the inset appearance which is useful for mixing a listview with other content on a page.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException
